U.S. Troops Warned against Complaining about Their Upkeep
articles.content:
U.S. Troops Warned against Complaining about Their Upkeep 
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the People's Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Troops in south Korea reportedly released a commentary titled "We strongly warn the U.S. troops against complaining about their upkeep" on April 2.
 The chief of staff of the U.S. command in south Korea at an urgent press conference on April 1 complained about the share of the upkeep of the U.S. forces agreed upon between south Korea and the U.S., openly threatening to fire more than 1,000 south Korean employees in its units, the commentary notes, adding that this reminds one of a thief crying "Stop thief!"    
 The money spent in the name of "upkeep" of the U.S. troops every year reached about three trillion won together with indirect expenses, it said, stressing that the U.S. forces should stop complaining about their upkeep at once and get out of south Korea.

U.S. Military Drills Denounced
articles.content:
U.S. Military Drills Denounced
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in Australia released a statement on March 25 denouncing the U.S. for rendering the situation of the Korean Peninsula strained.  The statement condemned all sorts of U.S. military drills contrary to the desire of the Korean nation for peace and reunification of the country as war provocation moves against the north of Korea.
 The U.S. is giving a lip-service to a peaceful solution to the nuclear issue and the six-party talks, which clearly shows once again that there is no change in the U.S. wild ambition for invasion of the north, the statement said, and stressed:    
  The U.S. should withdraw its hostile policy toward the north, stop the war exercises threatening the peace of the Korean Peninsula and come out to dialogue and negotiations with the stand of peaceful coexistence.

Greetings to Moldovan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Moldovan President
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Vladimir Woronin on April 7 upon his re-election as president of Moldova.
 Expressing the conviction that the relations of friendship between the two countries would develop in good terms in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the president a greater success in his responsible work for the economic stability of the country and the well-being of the people.

Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of his election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
 The letter was conveyed to an official concerned today by Iranian Military Attache Abdullah Hamidi Benam who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Foreign Athletes Here
articles.content:
Foreign Athletes Here
    Pyongyang, April 8 (KCNA) -- Athletes of China, Guinea, South Africa, Norway, Botswana and Zimbabwe arrived here to participate in the 18th International Marathon Race for Mangyongdae Cup to be held on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
